metadata.title: CVE-2017-5592 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description: An incorrect implementation of "XEP-0280: Message Carbons" in multiple XMPPclients allows a remote attacker to impersonate any user, includingcontacts, in the vulnerable application's display. This allows for variouskinds of social engineering attacks. This CVE is for profanity (0.4.7 -0.5.0).

criterions.comment: profanity: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
